channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023090349
item.description:
Report E-2023090349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While drums were in storage it was noticed that liquid had leaked onto a skid. The employee found a drum with a pinhole in it. They were able to transfer the material and cleaned up the mess in house. Only a very small amount was lost.

item.title: Report E-2023090348
item.description:
Report E-2023090348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to the tote being punctured by another pallet. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted trailer floor was cleaned with absorbents. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090109
item.description:
Report E-2023090109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SHELBYVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 10, 2023, at 2010 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Circle K personnel in Shelby, Indiana regarding the release of approximately 50 gallons of diesel fuel (UN1202, III) reportedly due to an overfill incident and was contained to a 60' x 30' area of concrete and asphalt. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite for proper disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages was loaded on side. Upon further inspection the hazmat was sat up right nad put in hazmat tote. DescribePack: bottle leaked from cap soiling package in corrosive liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was sat up right with lid tightened.

item.title: Report X-2023081542
item.description:
Report X-2023081542

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to door 16 in the unload, and damaged hazmat was handed to QA by a manager. When Hazmat was handed to QA, nozzle was leaking gas vapor. Hazmat was then placed in blue safety bag and red hazmat tote. DescribePack: Gas canister nozzle was only slightly loose causing vapor to escape. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed cannister inside of blue safety bag and red hazmat tote, tightening the nozzle.

item.title: Report X-2023081172
item.description:
Report X-2023081172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called by manager to truck claiming truck had leaking hazmat package. Hazmat was found to be leaking, package removed from work area and placed in hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Upon inspection of Hazmat, can was dented and had a loose cap causing contents to leak out. Cans had no clips on the lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leakage cleaned with spill absorbent, no contact was made with human skin.

item.title: Report I-2023090011
item.description:
Report I-2023090011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was unloading the product into the customer's tank while a customefs employee was monitoring the gauge on the tank(because the gauge was not visable from the truck). The customer wanted as much product in the tank and waited too long to tell our driver to stop the flow of product, causing 10 gallons to overflow from the tank into containment. The overflow lasted approxiamately 10 seconds.
